definitions.definition: An instance or example of using the word "but".
definitions.example: It has to be done – no ifs or buts.

definitions.definition: The outer room of a small two-room cottage.
The end; especially the larger or thicker end, or the blunt, in distinction from the sharp, end; the butt.

definitions.example: Christmas comes  but once a year.
I'll have to go home early but.
Nobody, but nobody, crosses me and gets away with it.

definitions.definition: On the contrary, rather (as a regular adversative conjunction, introducing a word or clause in contrast or contradiction with the preceding negative clause or sentence).
definitions.example: I am not rich but [I am] poor  not John but Peter went there.

definitions.definition: However, although, nevertheless, on the other hand (introducing a clause contrary to prior belief or in contrast with the preceding clause or sentence).
definitions.example: She is very old but still attractive.

definitions.definition: Except that (introducing a subordinate clause which qualifies a negative statement); also, with omission of the subject of the subordinate clause, acting as a negative relative, "except one that", "except such that".
Without its also being the case that; unless that (introducing a necessary concomitant).
definitions.example: It never rains but it pours.

definitions.definition: (following a negated expression of improbability) That.
